case_title: NASEEM HAIDER, JUNIOR DRAWING TEACHER, HIGH SCHOOL LOWAT, DISTRICT NEELUM, AZAD JAMMU AND KASHMIR vs SECRETARY EDUCATION, AZAD JAMMU AND KASHMIR MUZAFFARABAD and 7 others
court: Azad Jammu and Kashmir Service Tribunal
respondant: Secretary Education, Azad Jammu and Kashmir Muzaffarabad
complaint_summary: Appellant challenged his removal from service, alleging improper procedure and lack of notice or hearing.
investigation_summary: Appellant's appointment was found to be temporary and issued by an unauthorized authority. Allegations of misuse of power by the Headmaster were noted.

key_issues: Appointment made by an unauthorized authority.
Appellant removed without notice or hearing.
Replacement by Kh. Ejaz Ahmed, a regular employee.
court_findings: Director Education Schools (Technical) was not competent to issue the appointment order.
Divisional Director Schools is the appropriate authority for such appointments.
Initial appointment was temporary and flawed.
Termination order issued by competent authority and legally valid.

Decision_or_verdict: Dismissal of appeal; termination order upheld.
legal_arguments: Appellant argued removal was unlawful due to lack of notice and hearing.
Respondents argued appointment was unauthorized and improperly issued.
Respondents contended appellant wrongfully obtained salary.
key_issues: Authority of Director Education Schools Technical

legal_terms.status quo: A legal term referring to the existing state of affairs.

words_and_phrases.temporary appointment: An appointment made for a limited period without permanency.

summary_vector_notes: Appellant's temporary appointment was improperly issued by an unauthorized authority. Termination order was upheld as legally valid. Appeal dismissed with costs.
